forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy, with a low around 46. Northwest wind 12 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy, with a high near 59. North wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight wraps Boston in a cool embrace, the clouds hang heavy across the sky, heralding a night that promises to be crisp and brisk. Evening temperatures hover around a mild 46 degrees, while a northwest wind sweeps through the city, rustling leaves and carrying whispers of the day’s chill. The atmospheric motion offers an invigorating freshness, though the gusts can catch the unprepared off guard. Clarity may be somewhat muted under the blanket of cloud cover, yet the scattered city lights below twinkle like stars fallen to earth, hinting at stories unfolding in the streets below.

Tomorrow, as dawn breaks to tease the horizon, the overcast layer will persist, with the high struggling to reach a pleasant 59 degrees. A northward breeze will lend a note of briskness to the air, urging one to wrap up warm in layers—perhaps a snug sweater beneath a light jacket, suitable for both the lingering chill and the promise of a mild afternoon. A fine opportunity exists to explore local coffee shops, where the inviting aroma of fresh brews can be complemented by the comforting warmth of a cinnamon roll. Alternatively, savoring an afternoon stroll through the neighborhood, with the sounds of laughter and the mingling scents of street vendors, offers a chance to appreciate the quieter charms of this historic city along with its luminous skyline.
